33   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
34   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | 
37   | #include <stdio.h>
38   | #include <stdarg.h>
39   | #include <tcl.h>
40   | #include "config.h"
41   | 
42   | #ifndef CONST84
43   | #  define CONST84	/* const */
44   | #endif
45   | 
46   | #if (TCL_MAJOR_VERSION < 8)
47   | #  define TCL_RESULT(interp) ((interp)->result)
48   | #else
49   | #  define TCL_RESULT(interp) Tcl_GetStringResult(interp)
50   | #endif
51   | 
52   | #ifndef HAVE_STDINT_H
53   | /* assume 32 bit - hope for the best */
54   | typedef	int	intptr_h;
55   | #endif
56   | 
57   | #ifdef HAVE_STDLIB_H
58   | #  include <stdlib.h>
59   | #endif
60   | 
61   | #if STDC_HEADERS || HAVE_STRING_H
62   | #  include <string.h>
63   | /**
64   |  **  An ANSI string.h and pre-ANSI memory.h might conflict.
65   |  **/
66   | #  if !STDC_HEADERS && HAVE_MEMORY_H
67   | #    include <memory.h>
68   | #  endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and HAVE_MEMORY_H **/
69   | #else /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H **/
70   | #  include <strings.h>
71   | /**
72   |  **  memory.h and strings.h conflict on some systems.
73   |  **/
74   | #endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H  **/
75   | 
76   | #ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
77   | #  include <unistd.h>
78   | #  include <sys/types.h>
79   | #endif
80   | 
81   | #ifdef HAVE_CTYPE_H
82   | #  include <ctype.h>
83   | #endif
84   | 
85   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_MODE_H
86   | /* #include <sys/mode.h> */
87   | #endif
88   | 
89   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
90   | #  include <sys/stat.h>
91   | #endif
92   | 
93   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_TERMIOS_H
94   | #  include <sys/termios.h>
95   | #else
96   | #  ifdef HAVE_TERMIO_H
97   | #    include <termio.h>
98   | #  endif
99   | #endif
100  | 
101  | #ifdef HAVE_FCNTL_H
102  | #  include <fcntl.h>
103  | #endif
104  | 
105  | #if !defined(TIOCGWINSZ) && defined(HAVE_SYS_IOCTL_H)
106  | #  include <sys/ioctl.h>
107  | #endif
108  | 
109  | #if defined(DIRENT) || defined(_POSIX_VERSION)
110  | #  include <dirent.h>
111  | #  define NLENGTH(dirent) (strlen((dirent)->d_name))
112  | #else /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
113  | #  define dirent direct
114  | #  define NLENGTH(dirent) ((dirent)->d_namlen)
115  | #  ifdef SYSNDIR
116  | #    include <sys/ndir.h>
117  | #  endif /** SYSNDIR **/
118  | #  ifdef SYSDIR
119  | #    include <sys/dir.h>
120  | #  endif /** SYSDIR **/
121  | #  ifdef NDIR
122  | #    include <ndir.h>
123  | #  endif /** NDIR **/
124  | #endif /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
125  | 
126  | #ifdef HAVE_ERRNO_H
127  | #  include <errno.h>
128  | #else
129  | extern	int	  errno;
130  | #endif
131  | 
132  | #ifdef HAVE_LOCALE_H
133  | #  include <locale.h>
134  | #endif
135  | 
136  | #if ENABLE_NLS
137  | #  include <libintl.h>
138  | #  define _(String) gettext(String)
139  | #else
140  | #  define _(String) (String)
141  | #endif
142  | /* gettext_noop() equivalent */
143  | #define N_(String) (String)
144  | 
145  | #ifdef HAVE_ASSERT_H
146  | #  include <assert.h>
147  | #else
148  | #warning "not able to test code assertions"
149  | #define assert(condition)
150  | #endif

152  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
153  | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
154  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
155  | 
156  | /**
157  |  **  Structure to store information about a file.  Includes its name
158  |  **  and the structure to store information from the stat system call.
159  |  **/
160  | 
161  | typedef struct _file_entry {
162  |     char*        fi_prefix;
163  |     char*        fi_name;
164  |     struct stat  fi_stats;
165  |     int          fi_listcount;
166  |     struct _file_entry* fi_subdir;
167  | } fi_ent;
168  | 
169  | /**
170  |  **  Error handling (see error.c for weight and message)
171  |  **/
172  | 
173  | typedef	enum	{
174  | 	NO_ERR = 0,			/** No error			     **/
175  | 	NO_ERR_DEBUG,			/** Debugging			     **/
176  | 	NO_ERR_START,			/** Start logging		     **/
177  | 	NO_ERR_END,			/** End logging			     **/
178  | 	NO_ERR_VERBOSE,			/** Verbose messages		     **/
179  | 	ERR_PARAM = 10,			/** Parameter error		     **/
180  | 	ERR_USAGE,			/** Usage information		     **/
181  | 	ERR_ARGSTOLONG,			/** Arguments to long		     **/
182  | 	ERR_OPT_AMBIG = 40,		/** Option is ambiguous		     **/
183  | 	ERR_OPT_NOARG,			/** Option allows no argument	     **/
184  | 	ERR_OPT_REQARG,			/** Option requires an argument	     **/
185  | 	ERR_OPT_UNKNOWN,		/** Unrecognized option 	     **/
186  | 	ERR_OPT_ILL,			/** Illegal option 		     **/
187  | 	ERR_OPT_INV,			/** Invalid option 		     **/
188  | 	ERR_USERLVL,			/** Unknown userlevel		     **/
189  | 	ERR_GETOPT,			/** getopt() failed		     **/
190  | 	ERR_OPEN = 50,			/** Error opening file		     **/
191  | 	ERR_POPEN,			/** Error opening pipe	    	     **/
192  | 	ERR_OPENDIR,			/** Error opening directory	     **/
193  | 	ERR_CLOSE,			/** Error when closing a file	     **/
194  | 	ERR_PCLOSE,			/** Error when closing a pipe	     **/
195  | 	ERR_CLOSEDIR,			/** Error when closing a directory   **/
196  | 	ERR_READ,			/** Error when reading from a file   **/
197  | 	ERR_READDIR,			/** Error when reading directory     **/
198  | 	ERR_WRITE,			/** Error when writing to a file     **/
199  | 	ERR_SEEK,			/** Seek error			     **/
200  | 	ERR_FLUSH,			/** Flush error			     **/
201  | 	ERR_DUP,			/** File duplication error	     **/
202  | 	ERR_DIRNAME,			/** Cannot build directory name	     **/
203  | 	ERR_NAMETOLONG,			/** Directory name to long	     **/
204  | 	ERR_DIRNOTFOUND,		/** Directory not found		     **/
205  | 	ERR_FILEINDIR,			/** File not in directory	     **/
206  | 	ERR_NODIR,			/** Not a directory		     **/
207  | 	ERR_UNLINK,			/** Cannot unlink file		     **/
208  | 	ERR_RENAME,			/** Cannot rename file		     **/
209  | 	ERR_ALLOC = 70,			/** Out of memory		     **/
210  | 	ERR_SOURCE,			/** Error while sourcing ...	     **/
211  | 	ERR_UNAME,			/** Uname failed		     **/
212  | 	ERR_GETHOSTNAME,		/** gethostname failed		     **/
213  | 	ERR_GETDOMAINNAME,		/** getdomainname failed	     **/
214  | 	ERR_STRING,			/** string error		     **/
215  | 	ERR_DISPLAY = 90,		/** cannot open display	    	     **/
216  | 	ERR_IN_MODULEFILE = 100,	/** modulefile related errors	     **/
217  | 	ERR_PARSE,			/** Parse error (modulefile)	     **/
218  | 	ERR_EXEC,			/** Execution error (modulefile)     **/
219  | 	ERR_EXTRACT,			/** Cannot extract X11 ressources    **/
220  | 	ERR_COMMAND,			/** Unrecognized command	     **/
221  | 	ERR_LOCATE,			/** Module file not found	     **/
222  | 	ERR_MAGIC,			/** Bad magic number		     **/
223  | 	ERR_MODULE_PATH,		/** Module path not set		     **/
224  | 	ERR_HOME,			/** Home not set		     **/
225  | 	ERR_SHELL,			/** Unknown shell type		     **/
226  | 	ERR_DERELICT,			/** Unknown shell derelict	     **/
227  | 	ERR_CONFLICT = 150,		/** Module file conflicts	     **/
228  | 	ERR_PREREQ,			/** Module file prerequirements	     **/
229  | 	ERR_NOTLOADED,			/** Module file is currently not l.  **/
230  | 	ERR_DUP_SYMVERS,		/** Duplicate symbolic version	     **/
231  | 	ERR_SYMLOOP,			/** Loop in symbol version def.	     **/
232  | 	ERR_BADMODNAM,			/** Bad modulename in version, alias **/
233  | 	ERR_DUP_ALIAS,			/** Duplicate alias		     **/
234  | 	ERR_BEGINENV,			/** No update if no .modulesbeginenv **/
235  | 	ERR_BEGINENVX,			/** No MODULESBEGINENV env.var.      **/
236  | 	ERR_INIT_TCL,			/** Cannot initialize TCL	     **/
237  | 	ERR_INIT_TCLX,			/** Cannot initialize extended TCL   **/
238  | 	ERR_INIT_ALPATH,		/** Cannot set up autoload path      **/
239  | 	ERR_INIT_STUP,			/** No 'module load in the shellstups**/
240  | 	ERR_SET_VAR,			/** Cannot set TCL variable	     **/
241  | 	ERR_INFO_DESCR,			/** Unrecognized module info descr.  **/
242  | 	ERR_INVWGHT_WARN,		/** Invalid error weight	     **/
243  | 	ERR_INVFAC_WARN,		/** Invalid error facility	     **/
244  | 	ERR_INTERNAL = 990,		/** Error logger internal error	     **/
245  | 	ERR_INTERAL,			/** Alias module internal error	     **/
246  | 	ERR_INTERRL,			/** Error logger internal error	     **/
247  | 	ERR_INVAL,			/** Invalid parameter to the error   **/
248  | 	ERR_INVWGHT,			/** logger			     **/
249  | 	ERR_INVFAC,			/** Invalid error facility	     **/
250  |         ERR_ENVVAR,                     /** env. variables are inconsistent  **/
251  | } ErrType;
252  | 
253  | /**
254  |  **  Error return values. Only OK, PROBLEM and ERROR will be returned to the
255  |  **  caller, In case of the remaining, the error handler takes control over the
256  |  **  whole application.
257  |  **/
258  | 
259  | typedef	enum	{
260  | 	OK	= 0,			/** Everything's up and running	     **/
261  | 	WARN	= 2,			/** A warning (mapped to OK by the   **/
262  | 					/** Errorlogger			     **/
263  | 	PROBLEM	= 5,			/** Problem ... program might cont.  **/
264  | 	ERROR	= 7,			/** Error .. try gracefull aborting  **/
265  | 	FATAL	= 10,			/** The following will lead to the   **/
266  | 	PANIC	= 20			/** program being aborted by the     **/
267  | 					/** error logger immediatelly	     **/
268  | } ErrCode;
269  | 
270  | /**
271  |  **  Internal return value to handle the various ways a module load
272  |  **	could end.
273  |  **/
274  | typedef enum	{
275  | 	EM_OK		= 0,		/** normal return	**/
276  | 	EM_EXIT,			/** cmd: exit N		**/
277  | 					/** (set g_retval = N)	**/
278  | 	EM_BREAK,			/** cmd: break		**/
279  | 	EM_CONTINUE,			/** cmd: continue	**/
280  | 	EM_ERROR			/** abnormal return	**/
281  | } EM_RetVal;
282  |

288  | #define      MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH  8

296  | #define	UL_EXPERT	128

298  | /**
299  |  **  Debugging
300  |  **/
301  | 
302  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING			defined( WITH_DEBUG_INFO)
303  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 0)
304  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD_1	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 1)
305  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 10)
306  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 20)
307  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK_1	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 21)
308  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 30)
309  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 31)
310  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 40)
311  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 41)
312  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 42)
313  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_3		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 43)

325  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_VERBOSE		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".info"
326  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_INFO		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".notice"
327  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_DEBUG		DEF_FACILITY ".debug"
328  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_WARN		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".warning"
329  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_PROB		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".warning"
330  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_ERROR		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".err"
331  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_FATAL		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".crit"

339  | #define      M_DISPLAY	0x0002
340  | #define      M_SWSTATE1	0x0004
341  | #define      M_SWSTATE2	0x0008
342  | #define      M_SWSTATE3	0x0010
343  | #define      M_SWITCH	( M_SWSTATE1 | M_SWSTATE2 | M_SWSTATE3)
344  | #define      M_LOAD	0x0020
345  | #define      M_CLEAR	0x0040
346  | #define      M_PREPEND	0x0080
347  | #define      M_HELP	0x0100
348  | #define      M_WHATIS	0x0200
349  | #define      M_NONPERSIST	0x0400
350  |

388  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
389  | /**				      MACROS				     **/
390  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
391  | 
392  | /**
393  |  **  I'm going to remove all of the calls to free( ) since they are not
394  |  **    necessary for Modules.  Since the modulecmd program is only run for
395  |  **    a very short time ( usually <1sec) it's faster to not clutter the heap
396  |  **    by freeing up memory.
397  |  **
398  |  **  If you disagree with this decision, or have some problems with this
399  |  **    behavior on your system, configure with --enable-free
400  |  **
401  |  **  Note that all memory deallocations should go through null_free()
402  |  **/
403  | 
404  | #ifndef USE_FREE
405  | #  define  free( x)  
406  | #  define  FreeList( x, y)  
407  | #endif
408  | 
409  | /** 
410  |  **  Some systems don't define S_ISDIR and S_ISREG
411  |  **/
412  | 
413  | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
414  | #  ifndef S_ISDIR
415  | #    define S_ISDIR( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
416  | #  endif
417  | #  ifndef S_ISREG
418  | #    define S_ISREG( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
419  | #  endif
420  | #endif
421  | 
422  | /**
423  |  **  Error logger
424  |  **/
425  | 
426  | #define	ErrorLogger	Module_Error
427  | #define	LOC		module_name, __LINE__
